arts.ttl: What Nuno Espirito Santo was spotted doing as Nottingham Forest beat Exeter on penalties speaks volumes
Nuno Espirito Santo ‚Äòrelieved‚Äô as Nottingham Forest survive FA Cup scare
arts.sum: Neco Williams‚Äô spot-kick secured a home tie against Ipswich Town in round five.

arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest edge past Exeter on penalties
arts.sum: Premier League high-fliers Nottingham Forest struggled past 10-man Exeter City 4-2 on penalties to reach the fifth round of the FA Cup

arts.ttl: Watch: Nottingham Forest beat Exeter in penalty shootout
arts.sum: Watch the full penalty shootout as League One side Exeter City lose to Nottingham Forest in the fourth round of the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest beat 10-man Exeter on penalties as Devon double denied
arts.athr: Ben Fisher at St James Park
arts.sum: At 11.04pm, at last there was a result, Nottingham Forest avoiding an FA Cup upset against 10-man Exeter City after prevailing from the final fourth-round tie via a 4-2 penalty shootout victory. Neco Williams scored the decisive penalty before Matz Sels, who replaced the injured Carlos Miguel midway through the second half, saved low to his right to deny Reece Cole before Angus MacDonald blasted his spot-kick against the crossbar. It was an absorbing contest ‚Äì locals craned their necks from the windows of the terraced houses on St James Road to catch a view ‚Äì but a cruel crescendo for third-tier Exeter. Forest had a man advantage for 53 minutes after Ed Turns was given a straight red card for a high challenge on Morgan Gibbs-White, 23 of which were in second-half stoppage time after Taiwo Awoniyi suffered a concussion and broken nose. The striker received 12 minutes of medical treatment on the pitch but by the end he was well enough to salute the Forest fans, some of whom will do well to return home by 4am. ‚ÄúHe is in a lot of pain but with a smile on his face because he did an amazing job, scoring for us,‚Äù said Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo, relieved about his side‚Äôs progress and the injury prognosis. arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest beat 10-man Exeter on penalties
arts.sum: Nottingham Forest beat 10-man Exeter City in a penalty shootout to progress to the fifth round of the FA Cup, after Forest were unable to find a winner in extra-time against the League One side.

arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest finally win marathon FA Cup tie at Exeter on penalties
arts.sum: Forest, third in the Premier League and the highest-ranked team left in the FA Cup, will now play Ipswich at home in round five.

arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest deny ten-man Exeter on penalties after FA Cup fright
arts.sum: Exeter City 2-2 Nottingham Forest (Nottingham Forest win 4-2 on pens): The League One side very nearly knocked out the Premier League high-flyers
